original_title: Sri Lanka’s active credit cards fall
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s active credit cards have fallen for four straight months, official data show amid high interest rates and a currency crisis.
Sri Lanka had 1,975,335 active credit cards by October 2022, which had fallen to 1,942,272 from January.
In February 2023, the total active credit cards were 1,940,872 down from 1,940,272 in January.
High interest rates were discouraging credit card use, analysts say.
“It is costly to take loans because of the high level of interest rates being charged,” the analyst said.
Interest rates for credit cards surpass over 30 percent as the country battles its worst currency crisis, channeled through mismanaged decisions and money printing.

Banks do not charge interest if payments are made on the settlement date. Only about 5 percent of the outstanding balance has to be paid each month to maintain a loan balance in a card. (Colombo/April27/2023)
